metadata.title: CVE-2020-15664 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
By holding a reference to the eval() function from an about:blank window, amalicious webpage could have gained access to the InstallTrigger objectwhich would allow them to prompt the user to install an extension. Combinedwith user confusion, this could result in an unintended or maliciousextension being installed. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 80,Thunderbird < 78.2, Thunderbird < 68.12, Firefox ESR < 68.12, Firefox ESR <78.2, and Firefox for Android < 80.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15664` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 80.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 80.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 80.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '80.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
